definition: reluctant to part with (sth or sb)/unwilling to let go of
to give up/to abandon/to give alms
reluctant to part (idiom); broken-hearted at having to leave
to chip away at a task and not abandon it (idiom); to chisel away at sth/to persevere/unflagging efforts

sentences.english: As I watched her unload my luggage, I could see the sadness in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她帮我卸着行李，而眼神里却满是伤心和不舍。

sentences.english: There is no sadness, not so much nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么不舍，没有那么多废话。

sentences.english: Will say goodbye to classmates I really some give up.
sentences.chinese: 将要告别同学们的我还真有些不舍。

sentences.english: Some love can not insist we can only give up chic.
sentences.chinese: 有些爱，不能坚持，即使不舍，也只能够潇洒放弃。

sentences.english: We also indifferent to contentment, not with sadness of heart.
sentences.chinese: 我们也要淡泊知足，不要有不舍之心。

sentences.english: It was so cute that they didn’t give up on helping me with my pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 他们锲于不舍的指导我的发音，这真是太可爱了。

sentences.english: Grandson also not give KongZhu home the separated.
sentences.chinese: 孙子也不舍的分开了孔珠家里。

sentences.english: Get drunk every night, not evade, just don't care.
sentences.chinese: 夜夜买醉，并非是逃避，只是不舍。

sentences.english: May you remember the pain too, remember when I didn't give up and helpless.
sentences.chinese: 愿你记得痛过，记得分别时我的不舍和无奈。

sentences.english: But even if there is no amount of give up, some things will change and the past.
sentences.chinese: 但是纵然有再多的不舍，有些东西也会改变和过去。

sentences.english: Wang fang heart will not give victory resign, alone in the office liquor.
sentences.chinese: 王芳内心不舍胜利辞职，独自在办公室灌酒。

sentences.english: Young Germans willing to give up all for Web.
sentences.chinese: 德国年轻人宁舍伴侣不舍网络。

sentences.english: I always feel weepy when time comes for leaving.
sentences.chinese: 我总是会在离别的时刻感到不舍。

sentences.english: Although the four seasons, but also can only accept the fact that it is separated from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 四季虽然不舍，但也只能接受了与向阳分开的事实。

sentences.english: Trees know that meet in the future days, less to Hans a bit.
sentences.chinese: 大树知道未来相见日子渐少，对汉斯有点不舍。

sentences.english: The prince is going to a soldier, dont give up his childhood sweetheart lover core.
sentences.chinese: 王子尚要去当兵，不舍他的青梅竹马的恋人子芯。

definition: reluctant to part (idiom); broken-hearted at having to leave
reluctant to leave/to hate to have to go/to recall fondly
to miss/to long for/to remember with longing/yearning
to hate to do sth/to hate to part with/to begrudge
to give up/to abandon/to give alms
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
to feel distressed about sth/heartache/cardiac pain
